We called our credit card company and thankfully, they re-booked us at another hotel for that night.
reviews.title: The noisiest room I've ever checked OUT of

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are good reasons why locals hate this hotel. Between the bad service, the noise, and the hoardes of fist-pumping 20-somethings falling over drunk in the lobby and casino every night, the only extravagance in this hotel is tackiness. If you like good service and soundproof rooms, which any other hotel of this price range will offer, DO NOT STAY HERE.
reviews.title: Hip and Luxury in Sin City

reviews.text: We were in Vegas for a long weekend in October 2011 and wanted to stay somewhere different. I had seen all the hype about the Cosmo opening and we decided to try it out. We booked a 1 bedroom suite that overlooked the Bellagio lake. The view was incredible especially when the fountain show was going.
reviews.title: Another Review from a Hotelier..
gadgets to control your stay
reviews.text: The room was large, hip and functional. The rain shower was sizeable and connected to an oversized tub that had a window with a skyline. We only had one draw back in the room. Upon our arrival the mini frig was dirty from someone previously spilling an unknown liquid. It took two days for the cleaning crew to remove this from the frig. Apparently they are not to attentive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was a brezze and every intereaction with hotel staff was outstanding. The hotel is a hopping place and the crowd is a bit younger. We are in our early 40's but still felt welcome. However, we did not venture to Marquee (day club and pool). The line was always long and filled with young beautiful people. There is a separate pool that is much calmer.
reviews.title: Great 5 star contemporary hotel

reviews.text: Great hotel. May be the nicest of all I've stayed in Vegas. Nice people, good balcony, etc. Would normally rate it a 10. But I will never stay here again after my first time.
reviews.title: Great but watch your Credit Card

reviews.text: I used a credit card at check in which I had not used in over a year. Within one day fraud charges starting showing up. Either rip off employees or just bad handling of paperwork. Whichever, I will not return.
reviews.title: Great Hotel-if you're young

reviews.text: Had a business trip that took me to Las Vegas. Decided to try the Cosmopolitan. Check in was quick and efficient and as a Marriott Elite member I was upgraded to a Terrace Suite Very Nice room and very spacious. An odd thing however as large as the room was there was none, repeat no drawers for clothes. You either hang them in a closet or put them in a steamer trunk in the center of the room. The hotel was incredably loud. If you were over 40 you were truly were out of place here. All in all nice hotel but if you are over 40 you are going to be happier somewhere else.
reviews.title: A Lot of Hype in My Opinion

reviews.text: Stayed at The Cosmopolitan for the first time during a business convention. Glad the bill was paid by the company, as I would not choose to stay at this hotel on my own dime. First no-no for me was no coffee maker in the room. If a hotel cannot provide an in-room coffee maker, I will not return. Period. For all the glitz and glam this hotel has, I don't think this is asking too much. I was in a suite which had a refrigerator, stove, microwave a wine cooler, and the items need to make a martini, (but no coffee maker!). Looks really great, but there are no utensils, cook ware, dishes, etc. I had to ask for a wine opener (but there was a wine cooler).
reviews.title: Perfect for Party Time!

reviews.text: I do have to say the housekeeping staff on my floor was great and very pleasant. They are the best asset of the hotel in my opinion.
reviews.title: Glamour & Convenience All in One

aka: The Cosmopolitan Of Las Vegas Hotel Las Vegas
description: The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas is a unique luxury resort offering a decidedly different perspective, situated in the heart of The Strip directly between CityCenter and Bellagio. The resort’s uniquely vertical multi-tower design offers spectacular views of the vibrant city. The new 2,995-room resort features oversized, residential-style living spaces with expansive, one-of-a-kind private terraces. The Cosmopolitan’s luxurious resort amenities include a 100,000-square-foot casino; Sahra Spa & Hammam; three unique pool experiences at The Pool District; Marquee Nightclub & Dayclub at The Cosmopolitan, a multi-level integrated nightclub; and 150,000 square feet of state-of-the-art convention and meeting space. An eclectic lineup of new-to-market retailers include AllSaints Spitalfields, Beckley, CRSVR Sneaker Boutique, DNA2050, Droog, Molly Brown's Swimwear, Retrospecs & Co, Skins 6|2 Cosmetics and STITCHED. Signature restaurants include Blue Ribbon Sushi Bar & Grill by restaurateurs Bruce and Eric Bromberg; Comme Ça by Los Angeles Chef David Myers; Estiatorio Milos, by international restaurateur Costas Spiliadis; Holsteins from Block 16 Hospitality; Jaleo and China Poblano restaurants by acclaimed Chef José Andrés; Scarpetta and D.O.C.G. by award-winning Chef Scott Conant; and popular steakhouse STK from The ONE Group.
